decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of cogent evidence that the proposed vehicular crossover would not harm the health and longevity of the immediately adjacent street trees, which would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the quality of the public realm within Coombe Lane West and the character and appearance of the street and the wider area, thereby conflicting with Paragraph 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy 2012 and guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD 2013.

The proposed vehicular crossover, by reason of its excessive hard surface coverage, would appear an incongruous addition within the existing public grass verge area, which would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the quality of the public realm and landscape within Coombe Lane West and the character and appearance of the street and the wider area, thereby conflicting with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy 2012 and guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD 2013.

The proposed vehicular crossover, by reason of its excessive hard surface coverage, would appear as an incongruous addition within the streetscene, which would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the quality of the public realm and landscape within Coombe Lane West and the character and appearance of the street and the wider area, thereby resulting in less than substantial harm to the significance of the Kingston Hill/Coombe Hill Strategic Area of Special Character and conflicting with Paragraph 203 of the NPPF 2021, Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM12 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012.
